narrative.narrative: Cimber A/S is based at Copenhagen Airport and was founded in 2012 in the ashes of the old bankrupt Cimber Sterling, known as Cimber Air before it bought parts of Sterling in 2008. Scandanavian Airlines had a contract with it to have Cimber do flights for them and in December 2014 just as it looked like Cimber A/S would be shut down because SAS didn't renew the contract it was announced SAS would buy out 100% of Cimber A/S. It does regional flights and has six CRJ200's and an ATR 72-200. It had 4 CRJ200's in 2012.
